Key Match Events: Matthew Boyd will start in a win-or-go-home American League Division Series Game 5 against his former team, the Detroit Tigers.
The mentor-mentee battle between Boyd and Tarik Skubal will be a key matchup in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Matthew Boyd expressed gratitude and emotion for the opportunity to pitch in this crucial game after recovering from Tommy John surgery.
The Guardians decided to go with Boyd as the starting pitcher despite considering multiple options.
Boyd emphasized that the game will come down to execution, as both teams are familiar with each other's strategies.

Manager Stephen Vogt and the Cleveland team are aware of the significance of this game, as the Guardians have not been to the American League Championship Series since 2016 and have not won a World Series since 1948.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game will be played in front of a sellout crowd at Progressive Field.
The Guardians plan to use all available pitchers, including rookies Andrew Walters and Erik Sabrowski, if necessary.
